title: speedyb
author: speedyb
content: Any suggestions for asic resisting coins like etheruem to mine after etheruem mining is over. What is the most profitabl? Also what do you guys think of maybe trying prohasb

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: We are discussing about the coins to mine after ETH for some time  You can check these threads: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5413095.0 or https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5408199.0To at least have some thoughts, but there's no asnwer now, we have to wait some days to see how hashrate will be distributed among another coins, the price is also important to keep a coin profitable.Possible coins to mine after POS are: ETC, RVN and ERGO.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: they were also saying that ETC is not profitable. assuming you are not using green energy for it, i guess there is no means to make GPU mining profitable unless these tokens suddenly spied it prices. so it will make sense that ETC will soon go up or XMR or RVN.is there really no community who will remain in ETHW?

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: It’s pointless analyzing this right now.You need to see how much of the ETH hashrate is moved to other coins to determine profitability. ETH has an enormous amount of hashrate. Some ASIC some not. Some will liquidate their gear others will keep on mining.We will know more in about a week or so when the dust settles.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: speedyb on September 15, 2022, 12:48:13 AMAny suggestions for asic resisting coins like etheruem to mine after etheruem mining is over. What is the most profitabl? Also what do you guys think of maybe trying prohasbI will switch to ethereum mining classic. The calculator shows a profit of $8 from each terahash, although these values ​​have risen to $12. But I still have to pay for electricity. To see a more understandable situation, I think it will take up to several weeks.In such a situation, I pay about half of my profit for electricity. Miners with a price of more than 10 cents per kilowatt will not have a profit, or it will be so minimal that the payback will be more than 1000 days. Therefore, at this time I do not even try to look for a better profit.

comments.author: sp_
comments.body: Vertcoin is still pretty profitable with the Team Black Miner. $1 a day with the 3060ti (1.5MHASH)

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: adaseb on September 15, 2022, 02:21:37 AMIt’s pointless analyzing this right now.You need to see how much of the ETH hashrate is moved to other coins to determine profitability. ETH has an enormous amount of hashrate. Some ASIC some not. Some will liquidate their gear others will keep on mining.We will know more in about a week or so when the dust settles.The first day though is showing us that we are in the middle of a huge exponential increase of the difficulty of the network of ETC,almost 1/4 from ETH has already moved here as we are now near 3 P for just some hours more and last time around I checked ETH difficulty was 12 P or so,25% is already moved to ETC which has made this coin for GPU home miners totally unprofitable from profitable that it was just less than one day ago.As you say after some days we will see where the rest of the 9 P will move at which coin and only after that we can make calculations again.

comments.author: P00P135
comments.body: Quote from: sp_ on September 15, 2022, 01:07:06 PMVertcoin is still pretty profitable with the Team Black Miner. $1 a day with the 3060ti (1.5MHASH)sponsored comment...

comments.author: maXonja
comments.body: And where to get ethw wallet?

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Quote from: maXonja on September 15, 2022, 04:22:00 PMAnd where to get ethw wallet?Since its a fork off ETH I am pretty sure you can just make your own address and private key with the ETH software. You can load the eth client offline and create an address and save your key. And use that address to mine it too.You should start to mine ASAP before the hashrate grows. Later on you can get an official ETHW client wallet.

comments.author: sp_
comments.created_time: September 15, 2022, 05:41:39 PMLast edit: September 15, 2022, 06:01:27 PM by sp_
comments.body: Quote from: adaseb on September 15, 2022, 05:05:22 PMSince its a fork off ETH I am pretty sure you can just make your own address and private key with the ETH software. You can load the eth client offline and create an address and save your key. And use that address to mine it too.Yes, or mine to an exchange that support ethereum POW29 THASH now. 10% of the Ethereum Classic Network hash, and the coin is trading at $23 a coin7 times more profitable to mine than ETC..

comments.author: ccplz
comments.body: Quote from: adaseb on September 15, 2022, 05:05:22 PMQuote from: maXonja on September 15, 2022, 04:22:00 PMAnd where to get ethw wallet?Since its a fork off ETH I am pretty sure you can just make your own address and private key with the ETH software. You can load the eth client offline and create an address and save your key. And use that address to mine it too.You should start to mine ASAP before the hashrate grows. Later on you can get an official ETHW client wallet.So I can mine on let's say, an ethereum address created before the merge, that I currently have access to. Right?

comments.author: rasmukri
comments.body: I moved to mining RVN. I was on ETH at 200 mh/s and now I'm on RVN at 102mh/s which is about as expected half of the speed of ETH. Price of profit is the highest according to what to mine and I've done RVN in the past so I had everything already setup so no need to make a new wallet or reconfig a miner

comments.author: sp_
comments.body: Quote from: ccplz on September 15, 2022, 07:33:03 PMSo I can mine on let's say, an ethereum address created before the merge, that I currently have access to. Right?Yes, if you have access to the private key, or the exchange that created the new adress support ethereum POW. Binance and Coinbase might support it, but not yet confirmed.

comments.author: devil2man
comments.body: In my opinion the choice for the after eth is only between ravencoin, ergo and etc because it seems to me that ethw has not yet been fully developed personally i have chosen etc but not for the greater profits but for sympathy and ease of mining

comments.author: sp_
comments.body: The oldtimers are dumping their ETH and waiting to buy ETH POW. 2016 all over again... Easy money

comments.author: grendel25
comments.body: Epic Cash. It has been the most profitable coin to mine for years and now it's the ONLY profitable coin to mine aside from Kaspa and EPIC beats Kaspa by 25-45%... And... EPIC uses 52% less energy since it cycles to the CPU (and a little to ASIC) when it's not on GPU mining.  Now... if someone like sp_ would make some more 3rd party support so that we cold switch-mine to Kaspa when EPIC is on CPU cycles that would be pretty cool

comments.author: grendel25
comments.body: Quote from: sp_ on September 15, 2022, 08:43:25 PMThe oldtimers are dumping their ETH and waiting to buy ETH POW. 2016 all over again... Easy moneySpeaking of oldtimers. see my post above

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Quote from: sp_ on September 15, 2022, 08:43:25 PMThe oldtimers are dumping their ETH and waiting to buy ETH POW. 2016 all over again... Easy moneyHow sure are you that this is what's currently going on? ETH pOW has no meaningful use case, why would the big players go after ETH pOw? Anyway, I as a person will still gamble with the new ETH poW if the price crashes more, this is a high risk investment.
